comment._content: See also

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Dernberg and Delbruck were among a group signing a July 1915 petition to the German government against annexation of foreign territories by Germany. Already in October 1914 Delbruck had published a warning against plans of conquest. See books.google.com/books?id=ko-fAAAAMAAJ&pg=PA232&l...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Perhaps en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clemens_von_Delbr%C3%BCck But perhaps more likely the Hans Delbrueck mentioned in www.freefictionbooks.org/books/b/19339-the-better-germany...

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Could Dernburg be the guy here, Dr. Bernhard Dernburg: babel.hathitrust.org/cgi/pt?id=loc.ark%3A%2F13960%2Ft46q2... If so, page 3 may suggest more context for the photo: "The following article is from the pen of Mr. Edwvard Marshall and was printed in the New York "Times" of September 6, 1914, a few days after Dr. Dernburg's arrival in the United States in the interest of the Red Cross Society."

comment._content: See notes under for more information about Dernburg's mission in America at this time.
